post.title: Monogamy is a Social Construct, but So What?

div.p: The thing that annoys people about polyamory isn't that non-monogamous societies exist - everyone is implicitly aware of this, a structure that governs long-term sexual relationships is one of the core social constructs/base institutions along with religion, government and trade that exists in every complex society. There have been and are polygamous and other non-monogamous human societies in the world and most people are aware of this ("Arabs/Mormons have four wives" or whatever.)

What annoys people is that "polyamory" tries to reflect back some of the unique aspects of the affluent, western, 20th century-onward monogamous social construct - like the modern notion of marital partnership and hybrid romantic/sexual love between two partners in an organised union - back onto a more primitive, largely sex-focused tribal relationship where Grug and Grugette like fucking as many other Grugs as possible while also sometimes having the sax with each other.
Yes, monogamy is a social construct you can break free of. So is wearing clothes in hot weather. So is showering. What's your point?
